intro: Hylotelephium sanguineum, commonly known as the Armenian carpet or rock cranesbill, is a flowering plant native to the mountains of Armenia and Turkey. It is a perennial species belonging to the family Crassulaceae, characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant red or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It produces showy inflorescences that bloom in late spring to early summer, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Hylotelephium sanguineum is also known for its hardiness and ability to tolerate drought conditions.
